lexUnit.name: perceptive.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: having or showing acute insight.

sentence.text: Basil could read with ease the natural image-making of children and was in fact deeply knowledgeable and perceptive about the developmental stages of children 's drawings .
Indeed she had been sharp and perceptive about people .
` You 're always having to be perceptive in that line of work . "

` Very perceptive of you . "
He thought that was very perceptive of her .
` And it was very perceptive of you .
` How perceptive of you , cara .
Some people are just much more sensitive and perceptive in transmitting or receiving data than others .
